meanings.definition: The act or process of not managing or controlling something.
meanings.sent1: In the company, the nonmanagement of the project led to chaos.
meanings.sent2: Her nonmanagement of the situation allowed everyone to work independently.
meanings.sent3: The nonmanagement of the party decorations resulted in a colorful, but chaotic, mess.
meanings.sent4: The nonmanagement of the garden allowed nature to take its course, creating a wild and beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent5: The nonmanagement of the store's inventory led to confusion among the staff.

meanings.definition: The state of not being in a management position.
meanings.sent1: His nonmanagement meant he could focus on his own work without worrying about others.
meanings.sent2: The team appreciated her nonmanagement style, as it allowed them more freedom.
meanings.sent3: The nonmanagement of the department made everyone wonder who was actually in charge.
meanings.sent4: Her nonmanagement status gave her the opportunity to observe the dynamics of the team from a different perspective.
meanings.sent5: The nonmanagement of the company by the CEO surprised many employees.
